com.quest.glue.api.services
Interface CredentialValidator

public interface CredentialValidator

Common interface to test the availability and suitability of connections. All the various remote connection services provide the ability to test both whether the connection can be made or not, and whether that connection can access the required resources if it has been established.

Examples of this include UNIX environments, where user A may not be able to read user B's files. A connection made with user A's credentials would be insufficient if the agent required access to user B's files even though it can be established using either set.

Since:
5.5.5.1

Method Summary
 java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getTags()

Method Detail

getTags

java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getTags()
Return any tags that have been associated with this validator. These should be included in any results that are returned up to the FMS so that agents and cartdevs are able to figure out which events they are interested in listening to.

This method will never return null but can return an empty collection.

Returns:
Any tags (can be an empty set) that are associated with this test

validate

void validate(Credential credential,
              java.net.URI location)
              throws java.lang.Exception
Execute the Credential validation test

Parameters:
credential - The Credential to test
location - Location of the resource to test
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - The test was executed but failed
